component.name: FlaskConsoleOptions
component.custom-start-script: import sys sys.path.extend([WORKING_DIR_AND_PYTHON_PATHS]) from flask.cli import ScriptInfo locals().update(ScriptInfo(create_app=None).load_app().make_shell_context()) print("Python %s on %s\nApp: %s [%s]\nInstance: %s" % (sys.version, sys.platform, app.import_name, app.env, app.instance_path))

option.name: myCustomStartScript
option.value: import sys sys.path.extend([WORKING_DIR_AND_PYTHON_PATHS]) from flask.cli import ScriptInfo locals().update(ScriptInfo(create_app=None).load_app().make_shell_context()) print("Python %s on %s\nApp: %s [%s]\nInstance: %s" % (sys.version, sys.platform, app.import_name, app.env, app.instance_path))

task.summary: Default task

- removed I-I synapses because they were using the same model as E-E and I didn't want to deal with them - moved u equations into the neuron model (!!) - made plotting more self-contained by reading directly from RCN object instead of writing-reading from files
- added 'plastic_u' toggle back into u equations
- made testing file which for now reproduces STSP and threshold adaptation behaviour
- implemented experiment that simulates the firing of an attractor to look at STSP and threshold behaviour
- defined logistic and sigmoid-logit functions f(u) to map calcium to target threshold value - updated calcium_intrinsic_plasticity_test.py to better plot
- defined logistic and sigmoid-logit functions f(u) to map calcium to target threshold value
- added tau to logistic to move function
- added mu to logistic to move function
- added new Gompertz f(u) function to calcium_intrinsic_plasticity_test.py - fitted Gompertz f(u) using f(u)_fitting.py
- finding optimal Gompertz f(u) using f(u)_fitting.py
- finished finding optimal Gompertz f(u) using f(u)_fitting.py but still needs validating
- fixed color gradient for l1 and l2 - made plots nicer
- both f(u0 threshold and fixed-step were active at same time - remade plot_thresholds.py
- conda install numpy "libblas=*=*accelerate" doubles numpy performance
- normalised short term plasticity to be equal to w_max
- fixed imports and figures not generating in RCN_intrinsic_adaptation_simulation.py
- parallel grid search implemented in RCN_intrinsic_adaptation_simulation_parallel_multiprocessing.py
- catching zero-division in RCN_intrinsic_adaptation_simulation_parallel_multiprocessing.py
- added simple plot to RCN_intrinsic_adaptation_simulation_parallel_multiprocessing.py
- added logic to cleanup parameter results RCN_intrinsic_adaptation_simulation_parallel_multiprocessing.py
- generalised attractor number in RCN_intrinsic_adaptation_simulation_parallel_multiprocessing.py
- added plotting and results saving to RCN_intrinsic_adaptation_simulation_parallel_multiprocessing.py
- added plotting and results saving to RCN_intrinsic_adaptation_simulation_parallel_multiprocessing.py
- added random reactivation time in RCN_intrinsic_adaptation_simulation_parallel_multiprocessing.py so that cues come at random intervals
- rewrote count_ps() to deal with attractors being cued more than once
- removed redundant lists and using attractors_cueing_order for everything - print 'T' or 'S' to indicate PS type in plot_x_u_spks_from_basin()
- adjusted figsize to address spacing issues with multiple attractors in plot_x_u_spks_from_basin() - added PS statistics to plot_x_u_spks_from_basin()
- dumping and loading monitors after each simulation implemented by rcn.dump_monitors_to_file() - adapted plotting and other functions to load monitors from dump
- made PS finding sel-contained in the RCN by implementing rcn.find_ps(). This also lets us improve efficiency by caching results
- improved tqdm to use real length of simulation for estimation
- improved tqdm for multiple workers
- fixed small bug leading to doubling of parameter grid
- added rcn.low_memory toggle to only instantiate E_mon, which is necessary to compute the PS score
- fixed final bugs in running model with best parameters
- added attractor_size and network_size parameters
- RCN_intrinsic_adaptation_simulation_parallel_multiprocessing.py * working correctly with multiple sweeped parameters * added command-line parameters

- RCN_intrinsic_adaptation_simulation_parallel_multiprocessing.py: * handling no sweeped parameters * added reactivation_time parameter - other.py: * removed find_ps() - recurrent_competitive_network.py: * added temporal filtering to discard PSs that are too close

- RCN_intrinsic_adaptation_simulation_parallel_multiprocessing.py: * handling no sweeped parameters * added reactivation_time parameter - other.py: * removed find_ps() - recurrent_competitive_network.py: * added temporal filtering to discard PSs that are too close
- RCN_intrinsic_adaptation_simulation_parallel_multiprocessing.py: * calculating F1-score for sweep and using that to score models
- renamed RCN_intrinsic_adaptation_simulation_parallel_multiprocessing.py to RCN_sweep.py - can now sweep joint distribution with Gaussian or combination of parameters with Gaussian or grid
- RCN_sweep.py * joint gaussian and disjoint gaussian+grid sweeps working * adding default parameter set to sweeps for comparison
- moved run_sim() to recurrent_competitive_network.py in order to be able to re-use it in future scripts
- Added RCN_bayesian_search.py to run a parallel Bayesian search for optimal RCN parameters
- Small QoL updates to RCN_bayesian_search.py
- Small QoL updates to RCN_bayesian_search.py
- Bugfix in RCN_sweep.py
- Added results of bayesian and robustness sweeps
- Added results of bayesian and robustness sweeps
- Added results of bayesian and robustness sweeps

MESSAGE.value: - Added results of bayesian and robustness sweeps
- requirements.txt
- added background_mode switch to run_rcn() to automatically choose a larger network when attractors won't fit
- saving plot of best model in RCN_bayesian_search.py - added --parallel switch to RCN_bayesian_search.py
- automatically set N_i based on N_e to maintain 1:4 ratio
- added Telegram bot for notifications
- fixed bug on macOS whereby a socket needed to be close to be used by MongoDB
- added telegram bot
- integrating sFSA into Bayesian Search. Fails at line 470 of sFSA.py
- integrating sFSA into Bayesian Search.
- Telegram working
- All working for both RCN_bayesian_search.py and sFSA_bayesian_search.py
- Better tmp folders
- TelegramNotify now supports multiple concurrent chats with the bot
- Moved telegram notification service to run_rcn() - Added telegram notifications to RCN_sweep.py
- updated f1 score calculation to use 10 Hz as maximum accuracy - recalculated RCN search results with new accuracy and score
- FSA search needs debugging
- FSA search working
- Added recalculate_score.py to recalculate score based on new definition of optimal recall - Added RCN_energy_usage.py to evaluate energy usage for RCN based on various recalls
- Added progress bar to FSA
- Added recalculated scores
- Added option to switch telegram to test bot
- Updated feature_selection to remove nan values - Implemented feature selection
- updated __getMostActiveAttractor to exclude symbols
- small fixes to RCN_sweep.py
